title: I'm a Millennial With Classic Style—These 19 Free People Finds Are Speaking My Language
excerpt: A millennial fashion editor chose her favorite timeless pieces from Free People. Shop them here.
text: Free People is one of the few brands I've had in my closet for well over a decade—truly. There are many brands I've outgrown over the years, but I still always find so many treasures at Free People even though I'm not in my early 20s anymore. The offerings have gotten better and better over the years. Trust me. I shop a lot.When you think of Free People, there's a good chance you don't think of it outside of the casual, California-girl aesthetic that its campaigns and styling of its models capture so well. I wouldn't say that aesthetic describes me (my style leans much more classic), but some of the most worn pieces in my closet are from Free People—I kid you not. I just spent a good chunk of time scrolling through the Free People offerings and selected 19 standouts that I'd buy in an instance, some of which I already own. Keep scrolling to shop these finds along with me and prepare to hear "Where'd you get that?" every time you wear them. FP Movement Pippa Packable Puffer Jacket I own this jacket in multiple colors and wear it constantly for things like errands, Pilates classes, and dog walks. It's the perfect weight and fit and comes in tons of chic colors. We the Free Good Luck Mid-Rise Barrel Jeans The rumors are true—these under-$100 jeans are incredible. (Even Jennifer Lopez owns them.) We the Free Avery Vegan Suede Jacket This looks like genuine suede but is much less of an investment. We the Free Laydown Chino Pants I don't know about you, but I think my spring wardrobe needs a pair of butter-yellow pants. Free People Anna Eyelet Top The styling possibilities are endless. Free People Lowen Midi Skirt This pretty skirt sold out last year, so Free People did the smart thing and made it in more colors. Free People Nocturnal Solid Cardi Here's another item I own in multiple colors—powder pink is next on my list. We the Free The Perfect Tee After reading the reviews for this tee, I'm sold. Free People Margot Convertible Maxi Skirt This is convertible, so you can wear it as a skirt or a dress. More bang for your buck indeed. We the Free Opal Swing Denim Jacket Very into the oversize shape of this. Free People Salvador Midi Understandably, I added this to my cart immediately. I want it in every color. Free People Onda Drop-Waist Tube Midi This is going to sell out in no time. This popular jacket comes in so many cute patterns—see for yourself. Free People Lucienne Mini Love this easy ballerina-esque dress. The mock neck on this fitted tee is so chic. Free People Perfect Tones Set I don't usually go for sets, but this one is top-notch. We the Free Good Good Stripe Turtleneck I could see myself still wearing this 10 years from now. We the Free Level Up Slit Slim Flare Jeans Flared jeans are back, and Free People is a great place to buy them. Explore More: Free People Allyson is a senior editor for Who What Wear. She joined the company in 2014 as co-founder Katherine Power's executive assistant and over the years has written hundreds of stories for Who What Wear. Prior to her career in fashion, Allyson worked in the entertainment industry at companies such as Sony Pictures Television. Allyson is now based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and is originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She holds a BFA in theater arts. Her path to fashion may not have been linear, but based on the number of fashion magazines she collected as a child and young adult, it was meant to be.
html:
Free People is one of the few brands I've had in my closet for well over a decade—truly. There are many brands I've outgrown over the years, but I still always find so many treasures at Free People even though I'm not in my early 20s anymore. The offerings have gotten better and better over the years. Trust me. I shop a lot.

When you think of Free People, there's a good chance you don't think of it outside of the casual, California-girl aesthetic that its campaigns and styling of its models capture so well. I wouldn't say that aesthetic describes me (my style leans much more classic), but some of the most worn pieces in my closet are from Free People—I kid you not. I just spent a good chunk of time scrolling through the Free People offerings and selected 19 standouts that I'd buy in an instance, some of which I already own. Keep scrolling to shop these finds along with me and prepare to hear "Where'd you get that?" every time you wear them.

FP Movement

Pippa Packable Puffer Jacket

I own this jacket in multiple colors and wear it constantly for things like errands, Pilates classes, and dog walks. It's the perfect weight and fit and comes in tons of chic colors.

We the Free

Good Luck Mid-Rise Barrel Jeans

The rumors are true—these under-$100 jeans are incredible. (Even Jennifer Lopez owns them.)

We the Free

Avery Vegan Suede Jacket

This looks like genuine suede but is much less of an investment.

We the Free

Laydown Chino Pants

I don't know about you, but I think my spring wardrobe needs a pair of butter-yellow pants.

Free People

Anna Eyelet Top

The styling possibilities are endless.

Free People

Lowen Midi Skirt

This pretty skirt sold out last year, so Free People did the smart thing and made it in more colors.

Free People

Nocturnal Solid Cardi

Here's another item I own in multiple colors—powder pink is next on my list.

We the Free

The Perfect Tee

After reading the reviews for this tee, I'm sold.

Free People

Margot Convertible Maxi Skirt

This is convertible, so you can wear it as a skirt or a dress. More bang for your buck indeed.

We the Free

Opal Swing Denim Jacket

Very into the oversize shape of this.

Free People

Salvador Midi

Understandably, I added this to my cart immediately.

I want it in every color.

Free People

Onda Drop-Waist Tube Midi

This is going to sell out in no time.

This popular jacket comes in so many cute patterns—see for yourself.

Free People

Lucienne Mini

Love this easy ballerina-esque dress.

The mock neck on this fitted tee is so chic.

Free People

Perfect Tones Set

I don't usually go for sets, but this one is top-notch.

We the Free

Good Good Stripe Turtleneck

I could see myself still wearing this 10 years from now.

We the Free

Level Up Slit Slim Flare Jeans

Flared jeans are back, and Free People is a great place to buy them.

Explore More:

Free People

Allyson is a senior editor for Who What Wear. She joined the company in 2014 as co-founder Katherine Power's executive assistant and over the years has written hundreds of stories for Who What Wear. Prior to her career in fashion, Allyson worked in the entertainment industry at companies such as Sony Pictures Television. Allyson is now based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and is originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She holds a BFA in theater arts. Her path to fashion may not have been linear, but based on the number of fashion magazines she collected as a child and young adult, it was meant to be.
